intro: Orochaenactis thysanocarpha, commonly known as the silky flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Linaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fibrous stalks are valued for their soft, silky texture, which has been used traditionally in textile production. The plant thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in shaded, woodland environments.
